text: As they walked home, Elizabeth related to Jane the next day what had passed between the Bingleys and Jane, and for their sakes had patience with her. #PrideAndPrejudice

passages.fragment: As they walked home , Elizabeth related to Jane
passages.full_quote: <used>As they walked home, Elizabeth related to Jane</used> what she had seen pass between the two gentlemen; but though Jane would have defended either or both, had they appeared to be in the wrong, she could no more explain such behaviour than her sister

passages.fragment: Elizabeth related to Jane the next day what had passed between
passages.full_quote: <used>Elizabeth related to Jane the next day what had passed between</used> Mr. Wickham and herself

passages.fragment: what had passed between the Bingleys and Jane , and
passages.full_quote: She was perfectly sensible that he never had; but she wished to see whether he would betray any consciousness of <used>what had passed between the Bingleys and Jane, and</used> she thought he looked a little confused as he answered that he had never been so fortunate as to meet Miss Bennet

passages.fragment: and Jane , and for their sakes had patience with her
passages.full_quote: I was sometimes quite provoked, but then I recollected my dear Elizabeth <used>and Jane, and for their sakes had patience with her</used>
